sentences.en: He took an anguished breath. He had to be brutal and say it.
sentences.cn: 他痛苦地吸了口气，不得不坦言此事。

sentences.en: He was known for running a brutal extortion racket.
sentences.cn: 他因干过一起残忍的敲诈勒索而出名.

sentences.en: He was the victim of a very brutal murder.
sentences.cn: 他是一桩恶性谋杀案的受害者。

sentences.en: It was refreshing to talk about themselves and their feelings with brutal honesty.
sentences.cn: 他们直言不讳地谈论自己和自己的感受，让人觉得耳目一新。

sentences.en: Jensen is a dangerous man, and can be very brutal and reckless.
sentences.cn: 詹森是个危险人物，可能会变得非常野蛮而凶残。
杀人是一种残暴的犯罪行为.

sentences.en: Prison conditions have become more brutal.
sentences.cn: 监狱条件变得更加严酷。

sentences.en: She has to face the brutal reality.
sentences.cn: 她不得不去面对冷酷的现实.

sentences.en: The brutal soldiers beat their prisoners ruthlessly.
sentences.cn: 残暴的士兵野蛮地抽打俘虏.

sentences.en: They lived in happy insulation from brutal facts.
sentences.cn: 他们幸福地生活在不受残酷现实干扰的世界里。

sentences.en: They're brutal people behind their civilised veneer.
sentences.cn: 他们表面上温文有礼,骨子里却是野蛮残忍.

sentences.en: This juxtaposition of brutal reality and lyrical beauty runs through Park's stories.
sentences.cn: 这种残忍的现实和浪漫美好事物的并存始终贯穿于帕克的短篇小说中。

sentences.en: This was a brutal and cold-blooded killing.
sentences.cn: 这是一场残忍无情的杀戮。

sentences.en: With brutal honesty she told him she did not love him.
sentences.cn: 她冷酷地直接告诉他，她不爱他。

words.tran_cn: 粗野的；残忍的；野兽般的
残酷地对待；使像野兽般残忍，使变得残酷无情

trans.tran_cn: 野蛮的，残暴的，残酷的，直言不讳的
